definitions.definition: To a given extent or degree .

examples: Here's the measurement – the ribbon must be that long, no longer and no shorter.
She said we waited for three hours, but I'm sure it wasn't that long.
It didn't seem like ten miles, but actually it was that far.

definitions.definition: To a great extent or degree ; very, particularly .
examples: I was seen quite quickly — I didn't have to wait that long.
I did the run last year, and it wasn't that difficult.
How was the play? ~ Not all that good.
You're fun to spend time with, but I'm not that into you.
Ooh, I was that happy I nearly kissed her.
definitions.label_groups: informal , British , Australia , in positive constructions

main_definition: ( degree ) To a given extent or degree .
secondary_definitions: ( degree , in negative constructions ) To a great extent or degree ; very, particularly .
( informal , British , Australia , in positive constructions ) To such an extent; so .
